section.p: In , by default, image caching is not enabled. You have the option to have Glance image caching enabled and these steps will show you how to do that.

If you wish to use the Glance image caching option, you will see the section below in your ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/disks_controller.yml file. You will specify the the mount point for the logical volume you wish to use for this.
section.codeblock: # Glance cache: if a logical volume with consumer usage 'glance-cache' 73 # is defined Glance caching will be enabled. The logical volume can be 74 # part of an existing volume group or a dedicated volume group. - name: glance-cache size: 5% mount: /var/lib/glance/cache fstype: ext4 mkfs-opts: -O large_file consumer: name: glance-api usage: glance-cache
